docs.description: A generic helper method to create a record of any kind in DHIS2

tags.title: param
tags.description: Type of resource to create. E.g. `trackedEntityInstances`, `programs`, `events`, ...
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: Data that will be used to create a given instance of resource. To create a single instance of a resource, `data` must be a javascript object, and to create multiple instances of a resources, `data` must be an array of javascript objects.
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `options` to control the behavior of the `create` operation.` Defaults to `{operationName: 'create', apiVersion: null, responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `import parameters` for a given a resource. E.g. `{dryRun: true, importStrategy: CREATE}` See {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html DHIS2 API documentation} or {@link discover}. Defauls to `DHIS2 default params` for a given resource type.
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example 'expression.js` of `create` for a single program

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `create` for a single event

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `create` for a single `trackedEntityInstance`

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `create` for a single `dataValueSets`

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `create` for `dataValueSets` for sending a set of related data values sharing the same period and organisation unit

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `create` for a single `enrollment` of a `trackedEntityInstance` into a `program`

docs.description:
Update data. A generic helper function to update a resource object of any type.
Updating an object requires to send `all required fields` or the `full body`

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of resource to be updated. E.g. `dataElements`, `organisationUnits`, etc.
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: The `id` or `path` to the `object` to be updated. E.g. `FTRrcoaog83` or `FTRrcoaog83/{collection-name}/{object-id}`
tags.name: path

tags.title: param
tags.description: Data to update. It requires to send `all required fields` or the `full body`. If you want `partial updates`, use `patch` operation.
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `update` parameters e.g. `{preheatCache: true, strategy: 'UPDATE', mergeMode: 'REPLACE'}`. Run `discover` or see {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#create-update-parameters DHIS2 documentation}
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional options for update method. Defaults to `{operationName: 'update', apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example 'expression.js` of `update` for a single program

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Example `expression.js` of `update` for a single `event`

tags.title: example
tags.description:
update('trackedEntityInstances', 'IeQfgUtGPq2', {
  created: '2015-08-06T21:12:37.256',
  orgUnit: 'TSyzvBiovKh',
  createdAtClient: '2015-08-06T21:12:37.256',
  trackedEntityInstance: 'IeQfgUtGPq2',
  lastUpdated: '2015-08-06T21:12:37.257',
  trackedEntityType: 'nEenWmSyUEp',
  inactive: false,
  deleted: false,
  featureType: 'NONE',
  programOwners: [
    {
      ownerOrgUnit: 'TSyzvBiovKh',
      program: 'IpHINAT79UW',
      trackedEntityInstance: 'IeQfgUtGPq2',
    },
  ],
  enrollments: [],
  relationships: [],
  attributes: [
    {
      lastUpdated: '2016-01-12T00:00:00.000',
      displayName: 'Last name',
      created: '2016-01-12T00:00:00.000',
      valueType: 'TEXT',
      attribute: 'zDhUuAYrxNC',
      value: 'Russell',
    },
    {
      lastUpdated: '2016-01-12T00:00:00.000',
      code: 'MMD_PER_NAM',
      displayName: 'First name',
      created: '2016-01-12T00:00:00.000',
      valueType: 'TEXT',
      attribute: 'w75KJ2mc4zz',
      value: 'Catherine',
    },
  ],
});
tags.caption: Example `expression.js` of `update` for a single `trackedEntityInstance`

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `update` for a single `dataValueSet`

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `update` for a single `enrollment`

docs.description:
Update TEI if exists otherwise create.
- Update if the record exists otherwise insert a new record.
- This is useful for idempotency and duplicate record management.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Tracked Entity Instance unique identifier attribute used during matching.
tags.name: uniqueAttributeId

tags.title: param
tags.description: Payload data for new tracked entity instance or updated data for an existing tracked entity instance.
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: `Optional` options for `upsertTEI` operation. Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,strict: true,responseType: 'json'}`.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `callback` to handle the response.
tags.name: callback

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Throws `RangeError` when `uniqueAttributeId` is `invalid` or `not unique`.

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` for upserting a tracked entity instance on attribute with Id `lZGmxYbs97q`.

docs.description: Get DHIS2 Enrollments

tags.title: param
tags.description: `Query` parameters for `getEnrollments`. See {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#enrollment-management  here}
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `flags` for the behavior of the `getEnrollments` operation.Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - To constrain the response to `enrollments` which are part of a `specific program` you can include a `program query parameter`

docs.description:
Update a DHIS2 Enrollemts
- To update an existing enrollment, the format of the payload is the same as that of `creating an event` via `createEvents` operations
- But  you should supply the `identifier` of the object you are updating
- The payload has to contain `all`, even `non-modified`, `attributes`.
- Attributes that were present before and are not present in the current payload any more will be removed by DHIS2.
- If you do not want this behavior, please use `upsert` operation to upsert your events.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Path to the object being updated. This can be an `id` or path to an `object` in a `nested collection` on the object(E.g. `/api/{collection-object}/{collection-object-id}/{collection-name}/{object-id}`)
tags.name: path

tags.title: param
tags.description: The update data containing new values
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `import` parameters for `updateEnrollments`. E.g. `{dryRun: true, IdScheme: 'CODE'}. Defaults to DHIS2 `default params`
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `flags` for the behavior of the `updateEnrollments` operation.Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.description: updateEnrollments('PVqUD2hvU4E', state.data);
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `updateEnromments`

docs.description:
Cancel a DHIS2 Enrollment
- To cancel an existing enrollment, you should supply the `enrollment identifier`(`enrollemt-id`)

tags.title: param
tags.description: The `enrollment-id` of the enrollment you wish to cancel
tags.name: enrollmentId

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `import` parameters for `cancelEnrollment`. E.g. `{dryRun: true, IdScheme: 'CODE'}. Defaults to DHIS2 `default params`
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `flags` for the behavior of the `cancelEnrollment` operation.Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.description: cancelEnrollments('PVqUD2hvU4E');
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `cancelEnrollment`

docs.description:
Complete a DHIS2 Enrollment
- To complete an existing enrollment, you should supply the `enrollment identifier`(`enrollemt-id`)

tags.title: param
tags.description: The `enrollment-id` of the enrollment you wish to cancel
tags.name: enrollmentId

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `import` parameters for `completeEnrollment`. E.g. `{dryRun: true, IdScheme: 'CODE'}. Defaults to DHIS2 `default params`
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `flags` for the behavior of the `completeEnrollment` operation.Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.description: completeEnrollment('PVqUD2hvU4E');
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of `completeEnrollment`

docs.description:
Get DHIS2 Relationships(links) between two entities in tracker. These entities can be tracked entity instances, enrollments and events.
- All the tracker operations, `getTEIs`, `getEnrollments` and `getEvents` also list their relationships if requested in the `field` filter.
- To list all relationships, this requires you to provide the UID of the trackedEntityInstance, Enrollment or event that you want to list all the relationships for.

tags.title: param
tags.description: `Query` parameters for `getRelationships`. See examples {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#relationships here}
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `flags` for the behavior of the `getRelationships` operation.Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.description: getRelationships({ tei: 'F8yKM85NbxW', fields: '*' });
tags.caption: - A query for `all relationships` associated with a `specific tracked entity instance` can look like this:

docs.description:
Get DHIS2 Data Values.
- This operation retrives data values from DHIS2 Web API by interacting with the `dataValueSets` resource
- Data values can be retrieved in XML, JSON and CSV format.

tags.title: param
tags.description: `Query` parameters for `getDataValues`. E.g. `{dataset: 'pBOMPrpg1QX', limit: 3, period: 2021, orgUnit: 'DiszpKrYNg8'} Run `discover` or see {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#data-values DHIS2 API docs} for available `Data Value Set Query Parameters`.
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `options` for `getDataValues` operation. Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `callback` to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example getting **two** `data values` associated with a specific `orgUnit`, `dataSet`, and `period `

docs.description:
Generate valid, random DHIS2 identifiers
- Useful for client generated Ids compatible with DHIS2

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `options` for `generateDhis2UID` operation. Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,limit: 1,responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Callback to handle response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.description: generateDhis2UID({limit: 3});
tags.caption: Example generating `three UIDs` from the DHIS2 server

docs.description: Discover `DHIS2` `api` `endpoint` `query parameters` and allowed `operators` for a given resource's endpoint.

tags.title: param
tags.description: The HTTP to inspect parameter usage for a given endpoint, e.g., `get`, `post`,`put`,`patch`,`delete`
tags.name: httpMethod

tags.title: param
tags.description: The path for a given endpoint. E.g. `/trackedEntityInstances` or `/dataValueSets`
tags.name: endpoint

tags.title: example
tags.description: discover('post', '/trackedEntityInstances')
tags.caption: Example getting a list of `parameters allowed` on a given `endpoint` for specific `http method`

docs.description:
Get analytical, aggregated data
- The analytics resource is powerful as it lets you query and retrieve data aggregated along all available data dimensions.
- For instance, you can ask the analytics resource to provide the aggregated data values for a set of data elements, periods and organisation units.
- Also, you can retrieve the aggregated data for a combination of any number of dimensions based on data elements and organisation unit group sets.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Analytics `query parameters`, e.g. `{dx: 'fbfJHSPpUQD;cYeuwXTCPkU',filters: ['pe:2014Q1;2014Q2','ou:O6uvpzGd5pu;lc3eMKXaEfw']}`. Run `discover` or visit {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#analytics DHIS2 API docs} to get the params available.
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: `Optional` options for `getAnalytics` operation. Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Callback to handle response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Example getting only records where the data value is greater or equal to 6500 and less than 33000

docs.description: Get DHIS2 api resources

tags.title: param
tags.description: The `optional` query parameters for this endpoint. E.g `{filter: 'singular:like:attribute'}`.
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: The `optional` options, specifiying the filter expression. E.g. `singular:eq:attribute`.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: The `optional callback function that will be called to handle data returned by this function.
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Example getting a resource named `attribute`, in `xml` format, returning all the fields

docs.description: Get schema of a given resource type, in any data format supported by DHIS2

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of resource to be updated(`singular` version of the `resource name`). E.g. `dataElement`, `organisationUnit`, etc. Run `getResources` to see available resources and their corresponding `singular` names.
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `query parameters` for the `getSchema` operation. e.g. `{ fields: 'properties' ,skipPaging: true}`. Run`discover` or See {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#metadata-export-examples DHIS2 API Docs}
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional options for `getSchema` method. Defaults to `{apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `callback` to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.description: getSchema('dataElement', '{ fields: '*' }, { responseType: 'xml' });
tags.caption: Example getting the `schema` for `dataElement` in XML

docs.description:
Get data. Generic helper method for getting data of any kind from DHIS2.
- This can be used to get `DataValueSets`,`events`,`trackedEntityInstances`,`etc.`

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of resource to get(use its `plural` name). E.g. `dataElements`, `trackedEntityInstances`,`organisationUnits`, etc.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `query parameters` e.g. `{ou: 'DiszpKrYNg8'}`. Run `discover` or see {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html DHIS2 docs} for more details on which params to use for a given type of resource.
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: `Optional` options for `getData` operation. Defaults to `{operationName: 'getData', apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: returns
tags.description: state

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Example getting one `trackedEntityInstance` with `Id` 'dNpxRu1mWG5' for a given `orgUnit(DiszpKrYNg8)`

docs.description: Get metadata. A generic helper function to get metadata records from a given DHIS2 instance

tags.title: param
tags.description: Required. List of metadata resources to fetch. E.g. `['organisationUnits', 'attributes']` or like `'dataSets'` if you only want a single type of resource. See `getResources` to see the types of resources available.
tags.name: resources

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `query parameters` e.g. `{filters: ['name:like:ANC'],fields:'*'}`. See `discover` or visit {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#metadata-export DHIS2 API docs}
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `options` for `getMetadata` operation. Defaults to `{operationName: 'getMetadata', apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `callback` to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Example getting a list of `data elements` and `indicators` where `name` includes the word **ANC**

docs.description:
Patch a record. A generic helper function to send partial updates on one or more object properties.
- You are not required to send the full body of object properties.
- This is useful for cases where you don't want or need to update all properties on a object.

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of resource to be updated. E.g. `dataElements`, `organisationUnits`, etc.
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: The `id` or `path` to the `object` to be updated. E.g. `FTRrcoaog83` or `FTRrcoaog83/{collection-name}/{object-id}`
tags.name: path

tags.title: param
tags.description: Data to update. Include only the fields you want to update. E.g. `{name: "New Name"}`
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `update` parameters e.g. `{preheatCache: true, strategy: 'UPDATE', mergeMode: 'REPLACE'}`. Run `discover` or see {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#create-update-parameters DHIS2 documentation}
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional options for update method. Defaults to `{operationName: 'patch', apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Example `patching` a `data element`

docs.description: Delete a record. A generic helper function to delete an object

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of resource to be deleted. E.g. `trackedEntityInstances`, `organisationUnits`, etc.
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: Can be an `id` of an `object` or `path` to the `nested object` to `delete`.
tags.name: path

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional. This is useful when you want to remove multiple objects from a collection in one request. You can send `data` as, for example, `{"identifiableObjects": [{"id": "IDA"}, {"id": "IDB"}, {"id": "IDC"}]}`. See more {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#deleting-objects on DHIS2 API docs}
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `update` parameters e.g. `{preheatCache: true, strategy: 'UPDATE', mergeMode: 'REPLACE'}`. Run `discover` or see {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#create-update-parameters DHIS2 documentation}
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `options` for `del` operation. Defaults to `{operationName: 'delete', apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion, responseType: 'json'}`
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: example
tags.description: del('trackedEntityInstances', 'LcRd6Nyaq7T');
tags.caption: Example`deleting` a `tracked entity instance`

docs.description: Upsert a record. A generic helper function used to atomically either insert a row, or on the basis of the row already existing, UPDATE that existing row instead.

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of a resource to `insert` or `update`. E.g. `trackedEntityInstances`
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: An object containing a `attributeId` and `attributeValue` which will be used to uniquely identify the record
tags.name: uniqueAttribute

tags.title: param
tags.description: The update data containing new values
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional `import` parameters e.g. `{ou: 'lZGmxYbs97q', filters: ['w75KJ2mc4zz:EQ:Jane']}`
tags.name: params

tags.title: param
tags.description: `Optional` options for `upsertTEI` operation. Defaults to `{replace: false, apiVersion: state.configuration.apiVersion,strict: true,responseType: 'json'}`.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional callback to handle the response
tags.name: callback

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Throws range error

tags.title: example
tags.caption: - Example `expression.js` of upsert

docs.description: Creates a custom step (or operation) for more flexible job writing.

tags.title: example
param
tags.description: is the function
tags.name: func

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from source data.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: example
tags.description: sourceValue('$.key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `state`.
tags.name: path

docs.description: Ensures a path points at the data.

tags.title: example
tags.description: dataPath('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `data`.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from the source data objectusually `state.data`.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: example
tags.description: dataValue('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `data`.
tags.name: path

docs.description: Picks out the last reference value from source data.

tags.title: example
tags.description: lastReferenceValue('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `references`.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Scopes an array of data based on a JSONPath.
Useful when the source data has `n` items you would like to map to
an operation.
The operation will receive a slice of the data based of each item
of the JSONPath provided.

It also ensures the results of an operation make their way back into
the state's references.

tags.title: example
param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `state`.
tags.name: dataSource
